author: Liturgist
body:
The task is to iterate over the files in a tree structure, except those who have an `obj` directory in their path. It is not known how many or at what depth an `obj` directory might be found.

The only way I have found to omit the paths containing an `obj` directory is to filter it out with a `-like` pattern to run on all (current) PowerShell platforms. I find the pattern unattractive. The goal is to write PowerShell code that will run on all platforms without change.

Is there a better way to accomplish this?
```
Get-ChildItem -Recurse |
    Where-Object { -not ( $_.FullName -like "*[/\]obj[/\]*") } |
    ForEach-Object { $_.FullName }
```

comments.author: rahulduggal18
comments.body: Is this not a question asking for help to be posted on sites like stackoverflow.com ? How is this question an issue in PowerShell language?

comments.author: Liturgist
comments.body:
The language issue relates to what mechanisms PowerShell provides to handle differing path separators in actual code that a developer writes.

I will ask on Stack Overflow and close this issue. Although, I would welcome any suggestions.

comments.author: Liturgist
comments.body:
From Stack Overflow. This works. Is there nothing better/easier?
```
Get-ChildItem -Recurse |
    Where-Object { $_.FullName.Split([IO.Path]::DirectorySeparatorChar) -notcontains 'obj' } |
    ForEach-Object { $_.FullName }
```

comments.author: Liturgist
comments.body:
How about...?

Env:pathsep - / on UNIX/Mac, \ on Windows
Env:dirsep - : on UNIX/Mac, ; on Windows

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Perhaps add suggestion on shorthand for path separator to https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-RFC/issues/68

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: My understanding is that the initial request is `Get-ChildItem -ExcludeDirectory "*obj*"`

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Might be best to have a different issue opened to support wildcards on -Exclude (and presumably) -Include

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @Liturgist Do you agree with the suggestions?

comments.author: Liturgist
comments.body:
I agree that representation of the path separator text and having wildcards supported on Get-ChildItem -IncludeDirectory and -ExcludeDirectory parameters are two different issues.

It would appear that the Get-ChildItem parameters would have been useful towards the initial question.

However, an easier representation of the path and directory separator text would be helpful. Could these be Env: items?
